newsitem.title: USA: RG&E to shut NY Ginna nuke late Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: RG&E to shut NY Ginna nuke late Wednesday.

text.p: Rochester Gas and Electric Corp's 470 megawatt Ginna 1 nuclear unit in Ontario, N.Y., will shut down later today and be completely off-line by Thursday morning, the company said Wednesday.
"We'll start doing diagnostic testing to see what work is required," said company spokesman Mike Power, adding that a restart date was not yet known.
Impurities were discovered in the oil that is used to cool the plant transformer earlier in the week after plant operators reduced power to 80 percent.
The company said earlier this week that it planned to shut the unit "sometime this week" but could not specify the date.
Ginna typically produces about half of the utility's power output.
